scoreEntries.title: AD.1
scoreEntries.details: Must be cloned/forked from the relevant skeleton reference implementation

scoreEntries.title: AD.2
scoreEntries.details: Must be written in Python or Java

scoreEntries.title: AD.3
scoreEntries.details: Python applications must be compatible with Python version 3.9

scoreEntries.title: AD.4
scoreEntries.details: Python applications won't use Python version 3.8 or below

scoreEntries.title: AD.5
scoreEntries.details: Python server applications must use the Flask framework

scoreEntries.title: AD.6
scoreEntries.details: Python client applications with a queue listener must use the Kombu library

scoreEntries.title: AD.7
scoreEntries.details: Java applications must be compatible with OpenJDK version 11

scoreEntries.title: AD.8
scoreEntries.details: Java applications should be compatible with OpenJDK version 17

scoreEntries.title: AD.9
scoreEntries.details: Java applications wont use OpenJDK version 8 or below

scoreEntries.title: AD.10
scoreEntries.details: Java server applications must use the Spring Boot framework

scoreEntries.title: AD.11
scoreEntries.details: Java server applications won't use the Spark framework

scoreEntries.title: AD.12
scoreEntries.details: Must be compatible with the common development environment

scoreEntries.title: AD.13
scoreEntries.details: Commodities (i.e. local common-dev-env or lower region containers) must match the production deployment environment infrastructure as close as possible

scoreEntries.title: AD.14
scoreEntries.details: Code must conform to coding standards and style guidelines for Python, JavaScript, Java, Ruby and Delphi

scoreEntries.title: AD.15
scoreEntries.details: Must follow all TDA policies.

scoreEntries.title: PD.1
scoreEntries.details: All new applications must be deployed on to the Shared Technology Platform (STP)

scoreEntries.title: PD.2
scoreEntries.details: They must use the capabilities already provided by the platform as a default in production, e.g. postgres, rabbitmq, etc

scoreEntries.title: PD.3
scoreEntries.details: Services must be deployed using Helm charts

scoreEntries.title: PD.4
scoreEntries.details: Applications should be logically grouped together in a single Helm chart

scoreEntries.title: FD.1
scoreEntries.details: Services hosted on *service.gov.uk domains must use the GOV.UK Design System by following this guidance

scoreEntries.title: FD.2
scoreEntries.details: All other services must use the HMLR Design System

scoreEntries.title: FD.3
scoreEntries.details: External facing services must display the HM Land Registry branding

scoreEntries.title: FD.4
scoreEntries.details: All services must only use JavaScript for progressive enhancement, unless there is an explicit requirement that cannot be delivered effectively otherwise (see exceptions)

scoreEntries.title: FD.5
scoreEntries.details: All services must meet the WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility standards

scoreEntries.title: FD.6
scoreEntries.details: All services must contain a link to an accessibility statement, following the published template content

scoreEntries.title: FD.7
scoreEntries.details: All services must follow our policy on the use of Single Page Applications (SPA) and associated frameworks when deciding if one is appropriate

scoreEntries.title: APID.1
scoreEntries.details: HTTP APIs must be documented using an OpenAPI Specification following published government open standards guidance.

scoreEntries.title: APID.2
scoreEntries.details: OpenAPI Specifications should be available without needing access to a running instance of the API. E.g, stored in source control, or published in technical documentation.

scoreEntries.title: APID.3
scoreEntries.details: HTTP APIs must be designed following the API best practice guide

scoreEntries.title: FS.1
scoreEntries.details: Applications must use AWS Lambda for FaaS

scoreEntries.title: FS.2
scoreEntries.details: Each introduction of new functions must have an associated ODP published for review covering details such as purpose, sensitivity of data and comparison of execution cost vs hosted costs.

scoreEntries.title: INT.1
scoreEntries.details: Integration between applications must follow our integration patterns

scoreEntries.title: INT.2
scoreEntries.details: Integration with DB2 must follow our DB2 decoupling patterns

scoreEntries.title: CR.1
scoreEntries.details: Merge requests must be created for all code changes

scoreEntries.title: CR.2
scoreEntries.details: All code must be reviewed by at least one other peer who is not the author

scoreEntries.title: DOC.1
scoreEntries.details: Development/operations-centric technical documentation must be held in a technical documentation repository hosted via GitLab pages.

scoreEntries.title: DOC.2
scoreEntries.details: Product/service architecture and design documentation must exist on TechDocs based on the Product Template page.

scoreEntries.title: DOC.3
scoreEntries.details: Design models published on TechDocs should align with C4 modelling approach

scoreEntries.title: DOC.4
scoreEntries.details: Document based documentation (i.e. Word, Excel, Powerpoint files etc) must be stored in SharePoint.

scoreEntries.title: DOC.5
scoreEntries.details: Instant messaging platforms such as Slack, Teams etc must only be used for transient, point-in-time discussion.

scoreEntries.title: DOC.6
scoreEntries.details: Project management tools such as Trello, Jira etc must link to original sources and not become the sole source of technical information.

scoreEntries.title: TST.1
scoreEntries.details: Source code must be version controlled using Git in accordance with SPEC68 - Git Management Plan on the Process Index

scoreEntries.title: TST.2
scoreEntries.details: All new source code must be stored in our AWS hosted instance of GitLab (unless instructed otherwise by SPEC68).

scoreEntries.title: TST.3
scoreEntries.details: Compiled & binary artefacts must be stored in the appropriate hosted instance of Nexus

scoreEntries.title: TST.4
scoreEntries.details: Application dependencies and library requirements must be pulled from an appropriate hosted instance of Nexus

scoreEntries.title: TST.5
scoreEntries.details: Merge requests that are no longer needed must be closed

scoreEntries.title: TST.6
scoreEntries.details: Stale feature branches with no active merge requests must be removed

scoreEntries.title: TST.7
scoreEntries.details: Repositories that are no longer in use must be archived

scoreEntries.title: CICD.1
scoreEntries.details: Applications must be built and deployed using the HMLR Shared Pipeline components

scoreEntries.title: CICD.2
scoreEntries.details: Where common CI/CD functionality does not exist for the technology or framework being developed, the implementing team must take responsibility for working with the Practices to produce it

scoreEntries.title: TST.1
scoreEntries.details: Automated acceptance test suites covering multiple repos/apps must be written in Ruby using Cucumber

scoreEntries.title: TST.2
scoreEntries.details: For Python applications, automated tests must be compatible with PyTest

scoreEntries.title: TST.3
scoreEntries.details: For Java applications, automated tests must be written using JUnit.

scoreEntries.title: RD.1
scoreEntries.details: Applications must use PostgreSQL to store relational data

scoreEntries.title: RD.2
scoreEntries.details: Relational data wont be stored in a non-relational format e.g. JSON columns

scoreEntries.title: RD.3
scoreEntries.details: PostgreSQL database schemas must follow the naming conventions

scoreEntries.title: RD.4
scoreEntries.details: Applications won't use DB2.

scoreEntries.title: RD.5
scoreEntries.details: Applications won't use Stored Procedures
